911488441:
[

Disability Day Service Practitioner- Casual and Part Time- Geelong

Company Name genU Company Location Geelong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Company

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

genU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.

About The Role

We are seeking part time and casual Day Service Practitioners to join our Geelong team. As a Day Service Practitioner, you will ensure that all participants are supported as per their person centred plan and personal support strategies to achieve their individual goals.

Responsibilities Will Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Provide support to clients to achieve their personal goals through group and individual based supports
  • Meet the expectations and needs of program members and establish and maintain effective relationships
  • Provide support to program members to participate as far as possible in community activities where appropriate and be proactive in promoting community inclusion
  • Where required, assist program members to undertake a range of daily living including personal and self-care, eating and maintenance of personal hygiene during program time using the principles of active support


Skills And Experience

To be successful in this role, it is a requirement that you have:
  • Certificate III or IV in Community Services (disability) or equivalent
  • Previous experience in the disability sector, or a related sector including knowledge of providing client choice and self-directed supports
  • Demonstrated effective time management and prioritising skills
  • First Aid Level II
  • Strong interpersonal and team skills and behaviours, incorporating verbal and written communication, flexibility and resilience
  • Ability to write basic reports with intermediate computer skills using Word, Excel, Internet and Outlook
  • Intermediate numeracy and literacy skills
  • Knowledge of, and ability to implement the Disability Services Act and Standards
  • Additional Outdoor Recreation Qualifications are desirable.

In applying for this role, you will be subject to a Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme check. This is a check of an individual's name against a database held by the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) that records individuals who pose a proven risk to the health, safety or welfare of people with a disability living in group homes. If your name is on or is placed on the list, you will be ineligible to work as a disability support worker with genU.

Please find below the position description outlining full details of this role:

 DAY SERVICE PRACTITIONER 20180501- Casual& Part Time.pdf

For further details, please contact: Shelley Humphrey on (03) 5249 6138

Job description

Bank of Melbourne isn't just another bank. In five years, we’ve built a team dedicated to the needs of Victorians and their businesses. Our expert Industry Bankers have deep sector knowledge and the insight to support businesses to succeed.

Through our partnerships with Victorian institutions and associations, we give our customers access to local networks and a home ground advantage. We’re a different kind of bank, and our entire destiny depends on what happens here in Victoria.

The Opportunity

As the Transaction Banking Manager you will add value to our Commercial customers by optimising their working capital and delivering market leading payments capabilities; saving time and money whilst enabling their businesses to grow sustainably.

You will proactively grow and retain an existing portfolio of complex and high value customers by partnering with them to help them achieve their business goals through the exceptional transactional banking expertise you provide.

In this role your responsibilities will include (but are not limited to) the following:

What We Need From You

Application Support Administrator

Company Name The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners (RACGP) Company Location 100 Wellington Parade , East Melbourne, VIC 3002, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 11 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Australia’s largest professional general practice organisation
  • Permanent, Full Time opportunity
  • $72,491 per annum plus 13.5% super, based in East Melbourne

\xa0

The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners (RACGP) is Australia's largest professional general practice organisation and represents more than 39,000 members working in general practice. The RACGP's activities focus on the six key areas of standards, quality, education, advocacy, professional leadership and collegiality.

\xa0

\xa0

The position

\xa0

The RACGP’s Technology team is looking for an Application Support Administrator to join their team. This person will be responsible for administering and providing support for a range of business applications such as iMIS, EzeScan, Records Manager / Content Manager (RM/CM), and web applications (such as PayGP), with particular focus on EzeScan and RM/CM.


As the subject matter expert in EzeScan and RM/CM your primary responsibilities will include:

\xa0

  • Providing customer service and user support of business applications, utilising the service desk system for processing service requests and incidents.
  • Maintaining and updating knowledge base, training, procedures and reference materials for key business applications.
  • Ongoing administration of business applications, focussing on EzeScan/RM/CM.
  • Monitoring data integrity issues ensuring they are reported and managed accordingly.
  • Proactively identify, troubleshoot and resolve user, process, application and data integrity issues.

\xa0

The candidate

\xa0

You will bring to the role:


  • An ability to read and interpret records in order to classify them, apply retention, disposal authorities, workflows and access / security rules and conditions.
  • Demonstrated experience in an application support role including administering and supporting \xa0Electronic Document Management Systems.
  • Sound judgement and discretion with confidential information and an excellent ability to take initiative.
  • Excellent customer service skills combined with attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy.
  • Good analytical capability including attention to detail and trouble-shooting skills

\xa0

Any experience working within membership based organisations would be highly regarded.

\xa0

What’s in it for you?

\xa0

You will be joining a high-profile health and education organisation where progressive leadership, innovation, integrity, collaboration and accountability is valued. Benefits of working at the RACGP include 13.5% superannuation, easy access to public transport at a great location opposite the MCG, annual leave loading, additional leave over the Christmas and New Year period and discounts to a large range of retailers.

\xa0

In 2017 the RACGP became a winner in the Employer of Choice Award category within the Australian Business Awards. The Employer of Choice Award recognises achievement through effective recruitment, engagement and retention of staff.

\xa0

\xa0

To apply for this position, please click on the ‘apply’ button and submit your covering letter expanding on your skills and experience and your CV. Please ensure that your application is submitted in one PDF or Word document. Applications will only be accepted if they are submitted online.

\xa0



Applications close AEST 11:55pm – Thursday October 25, 2018

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

The Royal Australian College of General Practitioners is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and social inclusion. Applications are encouraged from people with a disability, people who identify as Australian Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, mature age and people from culturally diverse backgrounds. Candidates must have the right to work in Australia.

\xa0

Job description

About Artisan Aesthetic Group

Artisan Aesthetic Group is a premium, non-invasive medical business that empowers our clients to look and feel beautiful – inside and out. It is a new division of the 23-year-old, ASX-listed business the Vita Group. Our well proven, capable team is well-positioned and has the financial foundation to grow our clinic footprint to more than 70 premium, bespoke clinics over the next five years. It is our goal to lead the industry in the premium space of this category.


Our clinics are located in destination locations, providing an oasis for our clients to relax in whilst our client services team attend to their needs. We do not intend for our clinics to be based in shopping centre malls.


Our highly skilled in-clinic team of doctors, nurses, dermal therapists and clinicians consult with our clients to understand their needs and deliver a truly tailored experience from our expanding range of treatments including cosmetic injectables, laser and light based therapies and body treatments.


It is our intention to lead the category with regards to research and development, levels of customer service, quality skilled treatments, training and of course the utmost safety and care of our clients.


With our expansion plans under way, we have an exciting leadership opportunity for a dynamic and results-driven Regional Manager to lead our NSW, ACT and VIC teams and help drive the growth of Artisan. This is a great opportunity for someone to join the organisation in the early days, demonstrate their abilities and people skills in leadership, prove their business acumen, make change, create opportunities and ultimately make a difference.


The Role

This role is Sydney based and is currently responsible for leading 2 Area Managers and overseeing 6 clinics across NSW, ACT and VIC (which will grow over time to approximately 35 – 40 clinics). Reporting to the General Manager Artisan Aesthetics Group, you will be accountable for the team and financial performance.


Key Responsibilities

  • Ensure high levels of client service
  • Drive a focus on quality treatments and exceptional client care and safety
  • Create and maintain a high-performance culture, through leadership and coaching
  • Champion team member learning and development activities to promote growth, stability, and sustainability across the region
  • Develop and foster talent through proactive succession planning
  • Drive revenue growth and regional profitability
  • Generate and manage annual sales forecasts and budgets
  • Ensure all systems, processes, protocols are being adhered to throughout the region


About you

You are an experienced, self-driven, multi-site sales leader who has a strong understanding and belief in a consulting-led model. You will be passionate about coaching and developing your people and have strong commercial acumen skills, combined with demonstrated abilities to promote revenue growth and drive financial outcomes.

  • Demonstrated success managing multiple high-performing sales teams and leaders
  • Experience developing and managing budgets and key performance indicators
  • Confident, inspiring, and knowledgeable leadership style
  • Ability to maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Experience delivering presentations to senior leaders and/or board members
  • Tertiary qualifications in business or a related discipline will be highly regarded


Benefits We Offer

  • Discounts on products and treatments
  • Salary packaging
  • Education allowance
  • Child Care allowance
  • A paid day off on your birthday
  • A paid day off to volunteer


f you are a motivated and enthusiastic leader who wants to share their energy and knowledge in building a professional, high performing team and really wants to make a difference, then this is the opportunity to make your mark.

View our careers page at http://www.vitagroup.com.au/content/careers to learn about our business and dynamic culture or please contact Victoria Chatwood on 0439 580 339 for a confidential conversation.

Insights Analyst

Company Name Sportsbet Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We are looking for an Insights Analyst to join our team, pushing the boundaries and deliver small and large projects across the whole of Sportsbet.

Company

Sportsbet is Australia’s leading online wagering company. We're part of a global company, a big player with a start-up soul. The pace of change is exhilarating, we’re constantly innovating to bring excitement to life for our customers and our people.
  • PERKS:
  • 5 weeks annual leave
  • Tailored career development programs, as well as a commitment to developing Thought Leader and Specialist Talent programs
  • Free brekky, discounted gym memberships, loads of event tickets
  • Best in class Parental Leave program with six months paid leave for Primary Carers

JOB

In a highly competitive market, delivering competitive advantage through leveraging our data and generating timely, actionable insights will be key to providing the customers the best possible experience and enable Sportsbet to continue pushing the boundaries as a digital leader.

To deliver on-going success, Sportsbet are ramping up their Data & Analytics capability with increased focused on insights led analytics.

The role will deliver small and large projects across the whole of Sportsbet including Marketing, Product, Media, Risk & Trading, Customer Operations.

There is a real opportunity for the right person to shape this high-profile role and add significant value across the business.

Your Accountabilities Will Also Include
  • Ensure that data is analysed into meaningful, actionable insights that will improve decision making and consequently drive business performance
  • Deliver complex analytical tasks to the key stakeholders and the wider business
  • Manage and deliver project in a timely manner
  • Identify opportunities to develop standardised reporting dashboards and metrics freeing up time to spend on deriving insights for the business
  • Give business users access to faster, more insightful and more contextual information to help improve the speed and accuracy of business decision making
  • Analysis of online experimentation across the business to deliver insights and reporting
  • Ensure that reports are meaningful and are designed with the end user in mind

IS THIS ROLE FOR ME?

The successful candidate will join the Analytics team and will be a self-starter, a strong communicator and have a broad analytical, commercial and project skillset. You will have a delivery-focused mindset and experience in producing timely, high quality analytics and insights. ‌

You’ll be odds on for success by leveraging some (or all) of the following competencies.
  • Critical reasoning and ability to question traditional thinking
  • Ability to work independently and demonstrate initiative
  • Results focused
  • Collaborative
  • Ability to act at pace and be decisive
  • Commercial acumen
  • Strong stakeholder management
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong Excel skills (minimum)
  • Moderate SQL or equivalent (minimum)
  • Using and manipulating large datasets
  • Business Analysis and Requirements Gathering
  • Highly developed analytical skills
  • Strong logic and ability to explain complex analysis in a simple way
  • Power BI or similar BI tools preferred
  • Analytical experience (including web analytics)
  • Proven record in delivering insights based on analytics
  • Online experimentation and optimisation
  • Developing customized data reports to inform strategic leadership decision
  • Experience working in relevant industry (desired)

Bring Excitement to Life is our purpose not only for our customers, but also for the people we work with. Here is a quote from the hiring manager, about this role…

Join us in delivering game changing analytics to drive critical business decisions that shape the future of Sportsbet.

We encourage you to apply immediately as we will begin shortlisting within 1-2 weeks of advertising. Heads up - we use ability assessments, video assessments, interviews and a few toys in our Talent Assessment process!

At Sportsbet, we take Responsible Gambling very seriously. Check out the tools and information we provide our customers to help manage their gambling on our dedicated site at www.responsiblegambling.sportsbet.com.au

Who We Are

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities.

Position Summary

Downer is the leading provider of integrated services in Australia and New Zealand. Through trusted relationships and world leading insight we work closely with our customers to design, build and sustain assets, infrastructure and facilities. Our Infrastructure Services division operates three business units: Road Services; Infrastructure Projects and Utilities. As we continue our evolution of growth and innovation, the best people are critical to our success in supporting our customers and catering to market demands.

Downer Utilities has been successful in securing and delivering a number of exciting large-scale Power and Water Infrastructure projects including:
  • Transmission and Distribution Substations and power lines;
  • Wind Farms;
  • Utility Scale Solar Farms (>100MW); and
  • Waste Water Treatment Plants.

With an increased volume of work and activity within the Transmission Lines business portfolio we are seeking a dedicated Project Manager reporting to the Operations Manager to manage the growing portfolio of Transmission Lines Projects ensuring safe and successful delivery in line with client objectives, contract obligations and business goals.

About The Role

The Project Manager - Transmission Lines role will focus on the delivery of multiple Transmission Line projects for Victoria. This role draws on strong project delivery skills, sound understanding and awareness of “zero-harm” principals and processes, resource management and development, positive stakeholder engagement and solid project performance capabilities. The role requires an individual who has operated at a similar level within the sector, who is experienced in the construction of transmission lines (Pole and Lattice Towers) within the Power transmission environment in Australia.

  • Tertiary qualifications in Civil or Electrical Engineering or Trades background
  • Successful track record in Project Management within power infrastructure and specifically within Transmission Line construction

Technical Support Engineer

Company Name Twilio Inc. Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 110 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Because you belong at Twilio

The Who, What, Where And Why

Who?

Twilio is looking for a Technical Support Engineer to join our APAC team in Australia, supporting our customers’ use of Twilio’s various products. You will function as the voice of Twilio to our customers and partners and function as a subject matter expert for Twilio’s powerful communication API.

You should be excited by opportunities to problem solve and demonstrate a high competency in communicating complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences via phone or email mediums. You should have experience and interest in reading and debugging code in various programming languages and possess a high level understanding of troubleshooting SMS/voice call issues. Knowledge of Javascript or React is a huge plus. You should also have advanced time management skills, are able to work well under pressure, and are proficient at developing workflows to remain efficient at tasks while still following standard processes and procedures.

What?

A regular day in the life of a Technical Support Engineer at Twilio would consist of working on a dozen support cases submitted by both individual developers and major brands. Some examples include: debugging a customer’s code which is resulting in 400 responses, troubleshooting audio quality issue with customers that are using our Voice products, or perhaps speaking with a customer on the phone to guide them through development of their SMS application. Internally, you will be collaborating with your teammates and the Twilio Product and Engineering teams via Slack as well as filing JIRAs to report reproducible bugs, spending time reviewing internal knowledge bases to stay up on industry shifts and standards, and working with your manager to surface customer pain points to assist in process betterment.

Why?
Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. We only succeed at Twilio when our customers succeed. An outstanding customer experience with both our products and our service is an integral part of why customers choose Twilio, and your role is critical in ensuring the success here.

Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio. Come join us.

Where?

You will be based in Twilio’s office in either Sydney or Melbourne, with the flexibility of working remotely from time to time. You will enjoy our incredible perks: free Kindle when you build your Twilio app, monthly Kindle book reimbursement, monthly gym reimbursement, unlimited PTO, bi-weekly All Hands and more. What you will also get to experience is a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; that strives to balance work and home life, that understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture where everyone is able to do and be the best version of themselves. We seek people who naturally demonstrate our values, who are challenged by problems, empower others to thrive, people who can draw the owl and not be beholden to one playbook.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

By putting the customer at the centre, we create simple, effective strategies that connect with people across every channel - and grow business in ways they can measure. Role Overview:\xa0

We are seeking a Digital Analytics Manager to join iProspect’s fast growing Data, Insights & Strategy unit. The team has grown by more than 100% in revenues and headcount in the past 18 months and we have ambitious plans to grow the team even further in 2019.

You will be a strong, hands-on insight specialist with broad knowledge spanning both quantitative and qualitative research techniques as well as having a good understanding of digital marketing channels and the measurement techniques.

Product Development

Senior ITS Engineer / ITS Specialist

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Melbourne
  • Permanent Full Time


Senior ITS Engineers change how we travel. Especially in Intelligent Transport Systems, where the brightest ideas and most inspired engineering translate into safer, more sustainable roads. You’ll see engineering systems through their entire lifecycle, from initial specification through delivery and on to maintenance. Whether you are supporting existing systems or developing new ones, your engineering will make communities stronger.

The Senior ITS Engineer plays a pivotal role in the lifecycle management and delivery of engineering services to Intelligent Transportation System (ITS) projects within Transurban’s Australian Operations. Reporting to the Manager of ITS Engineering, the Senior ITS Engineer is responsible for defining, supervising and undertaking all system engineering tasks necessary to support the delivery and ongoing lifecycle support of ITS on local Transurban assets.

Our world-leading Intelligent Transport Systems teams invent roads for the future. They make toll collections easy and electronic. This team makes our roads talk. They build advanced control systems that monitor and manage traffic on the road – that can predict when an accident is more likely to happen. They make roads ready for driverless cars. And they plan smart traffic flow and signalling to get us where we’re going faster. A career here makes a difference you can feel.

The impact you’ll have
  • You’ll develop mission-critical engineering specifications, designs and solutions for tunnels, bridges and open roads.
  • You’ll make sure all our roads are ready for what’s next, investigating performance, supportability and obsolescence as well as system enhancement.
  • You’ll be a technical expert, developing junior engineers, partnering with project leads and advising on everything from governance and policy to tender negotiations.
  • You’ll build relationships that matter, connecting with people in Transurban and out, in Australia and internationally.
  • You’ll analyse reports as well as write them, making recommendations that mitigate risks, drive growth, cut costs or improve delivery.
  • You’ll never stop improving, keeping up to date with emerging technology and our own knowledge base.
  • You’ll be committed; travelling interstate and working out of hours when you have to.

The talents you’ll bring
  • A degree-qualified, professionally accredited engineer, you’ll have at least seven years’ experience and a hands-on understanding of ITS engineering or a similar discipline.
  • Whatever your background – infrastructure, defence, telecommunications, mining, rail, the energy sector – you’ll know how to deliver successfully and collaboratively in a complex, fast-paced environment.
  • You’ll be an influential presenter and credible communicator, writing reports that inform, engage and drive action.
  • You’ll balance engineering rigour with people focus, so you’ll know all about asset management and maintenance but appreciate the importance of contributing to budgets and annual plans.
  • Analytical and incisive, you’ll spot issues and use your own ingenuity – and that of your team – to solve problems collaboratively.

The rewards you’ll earn
  • We’ll make sure you have the tools you need to work smart and live better – including remote working.
  • We’ll develop you the way you want, with study assistance, training and career planning.
  • We’ll offer flexible leave, public transport ticket purchasing programs, insurance and salary continuance.
  • We’ll help you be healthy with flu vaccinations, fitness classes, fresh fruit and mental health support.
  • We’ll invite you to plenty of social activities, including ones that give back to our communities.


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you. Click Apply now.

Iteration Manager

Company Name Suncorp Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 133 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Iteration Manager
Iteration Manager – Policy
  • Take accountability for the delivery of value to stakeholders.
  • Prioritise removal of impediments and coach the team to resolve them.
  • Flexible working conditions.


The Role

The purpose of the Iteration Manager role is to take accountability for the delivery of value to stakeholders. Empower, lead and coach geographically dispersed teams to be successful, self-organising and adapt to change.

Key Responsibilities
  • Responsible for Agile processes and improvement within the team.
  • Prioritise removal of impediments and coach the team to resolve them.
  • Build strong, trusted relationships with business and customer groups and within the team, by helping the team to make their work transparent, and managing change as issues arise.
  • Maintain the focus on customer value and outcomes and maximise flow.
  • Lead a continuous improvement culture, and reduction of waste.
  • Lead the team to achieve continuous delivery and to build quality.
  • Help the team achieve a sustainable pace with space for innovation and learning.
  • Develop, monitor and communicate team reporting and metrics.
  • Proactively identify and mitigate risk
  • Coach the team on agile principles and practices to grow agile maturity and become resilient and high performing through coaching / mentoring and demonstration of thought leadership.


Skills & Experience
  • Tertiary Qualification in Information Technology and/or Business or equivalent industry experience Desired.
  • Certified Scrum Master/Iteration Manager and have solid experience in how to apply it Desired.
  • At least 5 years appropriate industry experience.
  • Previous experience in a large organisation.
  • Proved delivery track record.
  • Experience in leading geographically distributed teams.
  • At least 12 months in a Scrum Master/Iteration Manager role.


Benefits
  • Flexible working arrangements i.e. working from home 1 day per week
  • Up to 25% off insurance, Banking, superannuation
  • Employee share scheme (permanent employees only)
  • Continuity of service (MTC roles, contract to permanent)
  • Employer of choice for gender equality


About Us

At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

For additional information about the company click on link below.

https://www.suncorp.com.au/

If this sounds like you, apply online today. For further information contact Catriona Walshe on Catriona.walshe@suncorp.com.au

  • Insurance

Full-time

911236341:
[

Lead Data Warehouse Developer

Company Name iSelect Company Location Cheltenham, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description





Lead Data Warehouse Developer

  • Career Progression
  • Fast Paced and Dynamic Environment
  • Great Bayside Location with Onsite Parking


At iSelect, we get that most people find insurance, utilities and personal finance boring. But we understand that it's really important to 'always get it right'. As Australia's 'Life Admin Store', we'll help you take care of the boring but important stuff. We provide Australians with the convenience of an online comparison and the benefit of telephone-based advice and sales across many product areas.

Our intuitive technology and highly trained staff help our customers to confidently compare and buy from hundreds of policies, plans and products. We operate in a growth-orientated, agile and progressive environment that fosters innovation and rewards success.

What you do
As the Lead Data Warehouse Developer, you will be responsible for the analysis, design, development, enhancement, maintenance, and support of the enterprise data environment including Data Marts, Operational Data Stores, and Data Lake, from business requirements to development of logical design, translation to physical design, integration process and related code development.

You will be hands on design, development and operation of analytical and operational systems, and ensure on-time delivery by the data engineering team. The role is around 80% hands-on and 20% management.

What you need
Essential:

  • Significant experience with SQL/T-SQL
  • Strong experience with database management systems and data integration tools
  • Demonstrated experience in building data pipelines within a data warehouse, preferably in the Microsoft stack, including SSIS and SSRS.
  • Strong ability to multi-task, follow up and manage competing priorities independently
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • The ability to work in a fast paced, fluid, sometimes ambiguous environment
  • Excellent time management skills including the ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
  • Experience managing small to medium teams of data engineers


Preferred:

  • Exposure transactional big data environment
  • Exposure to Cloud technologies e.g. AWS and RedShift
  • Demonstrated software engineering
  • Familiarity with web API based architectures


Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree, preferably in Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent industry experience

What is in it for you:

  • A competitive salary plus generous yearly incentive program
  • Individual and career development to help you succeed
  • The opportunity to work with a well-known, Australian household brand
  • 3 'recharge' days per year (yes, in addition to your annual leave!)
  • Performance driven, casual environment and most importantly a fun, engaged and energised workforce!
  • A free coffee each day, a funky caf\xe9 and a state of the art work space
  • A generous Reward & Recognition Program and many other Employee Benefits!


Please note - shortlisted candidates will also be required to undergo background checks as part of the recruitment process. All candidates are required to hold relevant working rights in Australia.


Desired Skills and Experience

*Fast Paced and Dynamic Environment
*Great Bayside Location with Onsite Parking

Job Description

Job Details:

Ensures quality service and operational performance within the parameters of program and delivery standards that drive constant improvement in customer satisfaction. Develops client relationship and understanding of client business and product installations to identify service needs, plan service delivery and drive use of proactive service and support mechanisms to reduce client downtime and support costs. 911628774:
[

Chief Financial Officer (12 month contract)

Company Name Derwent Executive Company Location Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 62 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Chief Financial Officer role is critical in ensuring the future success in continued profitability and growth plans in the region. This role will incorporate all the traditional aspects of the role of a Chief Financial Officer for an ASX listed company, including the governance and reporting requirements of a public company and the development and deployment of a financial and operational strategy; policies and processes that drive the operational excellence of the function; and the ongoing development and monitoring of control systems designed to preserve company assets. With a direct reporting line to the Managing Director, this role will work closely with the executive leadership and sales team to monitor and implement strategic business plans and initiatives around performance improvement, costing, pricing, and systems / process refinement. This role will also develop strong relationships and negotiate the best commercial outcomes for the business with regard to all suppliers (i.e. Bill of materials, labour, property, insurance, electricity, staffing, services et al). Critical to the success of the incumbent will be the ability to partner with the Managing Director to drive a substantive process improvement throughout the business incorporating finance, corporate, sales and service delivery to position the business for sustained growth and profitability in the medium term.

In addition, this role will create the foundations for a strong commercial finance function that will provide recommendations to strategically enhance financial performance and business opportunities / performance, whilst positioning the business for future growth targets, both organic and acquisitive. In order to achieve this, the candidate will be required to introduce change effectively, refining reporting and analytical tools, aligning systems, service delivery, costing and pricing and integration of acquisitions.

The successful candidate will have a track record as a Chief Financial Officer / Senior Finance Executive in an ASX listed business. You will demonstrate the ability to work autonomously, with a proactive approach to improving the overall performance of the business, bringing insights and improvements to the attention of the Executive and the Board. Experience as a leader within a business that has gone through substantive growth and change will be highly valued, along with relevant business or commerce related tertiary qualifications supported by a CA/CPA. The candidate will possess considerable business insight and aptitude as well as thorough competencies in accounting and management reporting. The incumbent will be a 'highly strategic' member of the leadership team who spends time understanding the key drivers of the business and driving performance and accountability, ensuring there are no surprises and issues are quickly brought to the attention of the Managing Director. Ideally, the Chief Financial Officer will have had experience with market facing, capital raising and investor relations responsibilities.

If your experience is aligned to the description above, please call Mathew Newman for a confidential discussion on 03 9691 1333.

Seniority Level

Executive

Industry

  • Information Technology and Services

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Finance
